pr_title: Mapped most of the Entity Model classes

timeline.message: Mapped most of the Entity Model classes

timeline.bodyText: Why were all the methods moved above the inner classes?
timeline.author: Runemoro
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,84 @@
-CLASS com/mojang/blaze3d/platform/GlStateManager
+CLASS com/mojang/blaze3d/platform/GlStateManager com/mojang/blaze3d/platform/GlStateManager
+	METHOD alphaFunc (IF)V
+		ARG 0 func
+		ARG 1 ref
+	METHOD bindTexture (I)V
+		ARG 0 texture
+	METHOD blendEquation (I)V
+		ARG 0 mode
+	METHOD blendFunc (II)V
+		ARG 0 sfactor
+		ARG 1 dfactor
+	METHOD blendFuncSeparate (IIII)V
+		ARG 0 sFactorRGB
+		ARG 1 dFactorRGB
+		ARG 2 sFactorAlpha
+		ARG 3 dFactorAlpha
+	METHOD color3f (FFF)V
+		ARG 0 red
+		ARG 1 green
+		ARG 2 blue
+	METHOD color4f (FFFF)V
+		ARG 0 red
+		ARG 1 green
+		ARG 2 blue
+		ARG 3 alpha
+	METHOD colorMaterial (II)V
+		ARG 0 face
+		ARG 1 mode
+	METHOD depthFunc (I)V
+		ARG 0 func
+	METHOD depthMask (Z)V
+		ARG 0 mask
+	METHOD drawArrays (III)V

+		ARG 1 first
+		ARG 2 count
+	METHOD light (IILjava/nio/FloatBuffer;)V
+		ARG 0 light
+		ARG 1 pname
+		ARG 2 params
+	METHOD lightModel (ILjava/nio/FloatBuffer;)V
+		ARG 0 pname
+		ARG 1 params
+	METHOD normal3f (FFF)V

+		ARG 1 ny
+		ARG 2 nz
+	METHOD pixelStore (II)V

+		ARG 1 param
+	METHOD polygonOffset (FF)V

+		ARG 1 units
+	METHOD pushMatrix pushMatrix ()V
+	METHOD rotatef (FFFF)V

+		ARG 1 x
+		ARG 2 y
+		ARG 3 z
+	METHOD setupSolidRenderingTextureCombine (I)V
+		ARG 0 color
+	METHOD texImage2D (IIIIIIIILjava/nio/IntBuffer;)V
+		ARG 0 target
+		ARG 1 level
+		ARG 2 internalFormat
+		ARG 3 width
+		ARG 4 height
+		ARG 5 border
+		ARG 6 format
+		ARG 7 type
+		ARG 8 pixels
+	METHOD texSubImage2D (IIIIIIIIJ)V

+		ARG 1 level
+		ARG 2 xOffset

+		ARG 4 width
+		ARG 5 height
+		ARG 6 format
+		ARG 7 type
+		ARG 8 pixels
 	CLASS class_1016 AlphaTestState

replies.bodyText:
IDEA automatic pre-commit formatting.
Why? Did it mess something up?
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: Hm? I'm asking why the methods of this class, which were below the inner classes, were moved to be above them. Why would IDEA format .mapping files?
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: Don't know. But that is the only explanation I can come up with. I certainly didn't move it around myself, and I did have auto-formatting turned on.
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: Can I resolve this? It seems like a non-issue, but I'm not sure.
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: Yeah not an issue, the order was just wrong before
replies.author: YanisBft

timeline.author: YanisBft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -49,7 +49,6 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_630 net/minecraft/client/model/ModelPart
 		ARG 5 sizeX
 		ARG 6 sizeY
 		ARG 7 sizeZ
-		ARG 8 extra

replies.bodyText:
"extra" isn't accurate, or really descriptive of what the param is for.
And I don't think we know what is accurate, at this point. We used to think it was "scale" but in practice, that doesn't really work.
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: I think an inaccurate name is better than nothing, especially for a primitive type
replies.author: YanisBft

replies.bodyText: What is this arg even meant to do? Most of the time it just makes models ugly if it's anything but 0, so I leave it alone.
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: Ah, I think it's the scale then
replies.author: YanisBft

replies.bodyText:
I suggest playing with it yourself to see how it works. If it does control scale, it does so VERY incorrectly.


(And yes, these were taken in a 1.16 project. My 1.14.4 project doesn't have any large enough mobs to be able to clearly see the difference.)
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: Maybe scale is not the right word, but what it seems to do is extending the texture to an "extra" x, y and z (being the same value with the extra param)
replies.author: YanisBft

replies.bodyText: This should probably be the topic of a larger discussion, since it will probably effect newer versions. (at least, I think it should.)
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: Resolving this now. Be sure to bring it up later.
replies.author: halotroop2288

timeline.author: YanisBft
YanisBft
YanisBft

replies.bodyText:
What do you mean by this?
It seems pretty clear to me at least that method_17106 is animateModel, as an extension of a more complex method.
I believe I copied them both from the newer version.
replies.author: halotroop2288

timeline.bodyText: Not the shell, it's a very little part of the model. See images below (first is with this part visible, second not visible)
timeline.author: YanisBft

replies.bodyText: is "belly" better? That's what I went with in the latest commit.
replies.author: halotroop2288

replies.bodyText: 'Plastron' if you wanted to be anatomically correct
replies.author: haykam821

timeline.bodyText: Wait you removed the file instead of just the field
timeline.author: YanisBft

timeline.message:
Apparently this is anatomically correct, according to Haykam.

Included a JavaDoc for anyone who is not familiar with Turtle anatomy.
Mapped one (redundant, probably used for debug) field

timeline.author: haykam821
haykam821

timeline.message:
Accept haykam's change: tail -> legs

Accept haykam's change: feet -> foot
